SEARCH
Package app.user

Class Player

java.lang.Object
app.user.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComputerPlayer, HumanPlayer
public abstract class Player extends Object
Player is the base class for all players in the Parade game. It contains general methods and attributes that are common to both HumanPlayer and ComputerPlayer. The Player class manages the player's hand, collected cards, and provides methods for game actions like playing cards and calculating scores.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, List<Card> hand)
      Creates a new player with the specified name and starting hand. Initializes an empty collection zone for collected cards.
      Parameters:
      name - The player's name
      hand - The initial hand of cards

  • Method Details

    • playCard

      public abstract Card playCard(ParadeLine pLine)
      Plays a card from the player's hand to the parade line. This is an abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses.
      Parameters:
      pLine - Current ParadeLine.
      Returns:
      The card that is played

    • addToCollection

      public void addToCollection(List<Card> cards)
      Adds cards collected from the parade line to the player's collection zone.
      Parameters:
      cards - The cards to add to the collection zone

    • removeCardFromHand

      public void removeCardFromHand(int cardIndex)
      Removes a card from the player's hand at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      cardIndex - The index of the card to remove

    • discardCardsAtFinalRound

      public void discardCardsAtFinalRound(int indx1, int indx2)
      Discards 2 cards from the player's hand at the final round. The remaining cards are added to the collection zone.
      Parameters:
      indx1 - Index of the first card to discard
      indx2 - Index of the second card to discard

    • calculateScore

      public Map<String,Pair<Integer,Integer>> calculateScore()
      Calculates the player's score based on collected cards. Returns a map where each color is mapped to a pair containing: 1. The number of cards of that color 2. The total points of cards of that color
      Returns:
      Map of color to card count and point total

    • getCardFromDeck

      public void getCardFromDeck(Card card)
      Adds a card drawn from the deck to the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      card - The card drawn from the deck

    • hasAllColor

      public boolean hasAllColor()
      Checks if the player has collected at least one card of each color.
      Returns:
      true if all colors are represented, false otherwise

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Player p)
      Checks if this player is equal to another player. Two players are equal if they have the same name.
      Parameters:
      p - The player to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the players have the same name, false otherwise

    • displayCollected

      public String displayCollected()
      Returns a string representation of the collected cards, organized vertically by color.
      Returns:
      Formatted string of collected cards

    • getName

      public String getName()

      Returns:
      The player's name

      public List<Card> getHand()
      Gets the player's current hand.
      Returns:
